bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from H.S. Parsons to Philip Showalter Hench, February 22, 1941

div1.p: Parsons lists the names of newspapers and magazines published in Havana, Cuba, which are available at the Periodical Division of the Library of Congress. "La Discusion," from February 8, 1901, shows a front-page cartoon ridiculing various theories on yellow fever - including the mosquito vector.

div1.head: Letter from H.S. Parsons to Philip Showalter Hench, February 22, 1941
div1.opener:
THE LIBRARY OF CONGRESS
PERIODICAL DIVISION
WASHINGTON
February 22, 1941
All correspondence should be addressed
“THE LIBRARIAN OF CONGRESS
WASHINGTON, D. C.”
__________
In reply quote file No. PE
Dr. P. S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Sir,
div1.p:
Your letter of Jan. 29, 1941, has been referred to
the Periodical Division for reply as to Havana newspapers and
magazines.

The Library of Congress files include:
Cuba y America. Habana. AP63.C8
v. l-6, Apr. 1897-Apr. 1901.
El Curioso Americano. Habana. AP63.C85
Epoca 3, no. 1-12, July, 1899-Oct. 1900.
3, ano 2, no. 1-5, Jan.-May, 1901.
Revista Cubana Periodico Mensuel. Habana.
v. 11-17, Han. 1890-June, 1893. AP63.R54
Diario de la Marina. daily.
1900-1901. July-Mar.
La Discusion. daily.
1900. July 1-14,16,21,23,28,30, Aug.7-10,
28-31, Sept. 4,5, Oct. 27,29, Nov. 23,
Dec. 24,26-28.
1901. Jan.3-5,9-11,13,21,28-30, Feb.1,4-9,
13,22,23,28, Mar.8,9,14-18,20,27.
The Havana Post. daily.
1900. May 26,30, June 13,14,28,29, July 18-21,
28, Aug. 7,9,10,18,21,22, Nov. 13-18.
1901. Feb. 5, June 23,25-30, July 2-4,6,7,9-14,
16,17,19-21,23-27,30,31.
Patria. daily.
1901. Mar. 16-19,28-Apr. 2,6-13,16,
Supplement Apr. 6, 13.
La Union Espanola. daily.
1900-1901. July 1-Jan. 19. incomplete.
----- Edicion de la tarde. daily.
1900. July 1-27, Aug. 1-7, 11-17,20-Sept. 3,10,
26-Oct. 5,9-12,15-19,22-Nov. 9,17,19,23,
26,28, Dec. 1-4,8-12,14-17,19-21,24,26-28.

As you will see the Library of Congress does not have
La Discusion, Nov. 21, 1900, or The Havana Post, Nov. 24,25, Dec. 23,1900,
Jan. 30,31, 1901.

The Library has examined the Havana Post, Feb. 5, 1901,
La Discusion, Feb. 5,6,8,1901, and Diario de la Marina, Feb. 5,6,8,1901.
Articles on the Pan-American Medical Congress appear, but nothing
on Maj. Walter Reed. La Discusion of Feb. 6 reports the meeting of
Feb. 5 and mentions briefly a discussion on yellow fever by Dr. Vila.
0La Discusion of Feb. 8 has a front-page cartoon ridiculing various
theories on yellow fever including the mosquito theory. No other
pertinent items were found.

Our records do not show files of these Havana papers in
other United States libraries for the period needed.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, H. S. Parsons
Chief, Periodical Division Nuermo
glandez
From Nadigles
se La es [?] - miercoles Feb 6 1901
page 2-3 Terces cong med
